to eat: You like to go to the mall.
ate: You liked to go to the mall.

to eat: He likes to drink coffee in the morning.
ate: He liked to drink coffee in the morning.

to eat: He likes to watch movies with me.
ate: He liked to watch movies with me.

to eat: She wants to eat pizza at night.
ate: She wanted to eat pizza at night.

to eat: I am a teacher, but I work at a bank.
ate: I was a teacher, but I worked at a bank.

to eat: They have a lot of friends in the USA.
ate: They had a lot of friends in the USA.

to eat: It is not a dog. It is a cat.
ate: It was not a dog. It was a cat.

to eat: You do not have to go to work.
ate: You did not have to go to work.

to eat: Do you like to buy fruits at the supermarket?
ate: Did you like to buy fruits at the supermarket?

to eat: Does he live with his parents downtown?
ate: Did he live with his parents downtown?

to eat: Why does your mother want to sell her house?
ate: Why did your mother want to sell her house?

to eat: They are not married, they are good friends.
ate: They were not married, they were good friends.
